name: get bearer
info:
Get a new bearer and refresh token and stores it in global variables. 

The global variables system_bearerMiele and system_refreshMiele are being used.

name: get all appliances
info:
Get a list of all appliances with indentification and state.

Prereq: bearer in global variable system_bearerMiele

name: get appliance
info:
Get an object with identification and state data for the given appliance id.

Prereq: bearer in global variable system_bearerMiele

name: get actions
info:
Get an object with all valid actions for the given appliance id at the current appliance state.

Prereq: bearer in global variable system_bearerMiele

name: set action
info: Set (execute) an action for the given appliance. Valid action depend on kind of appliance and state!
inputLabels: appliance id in payload and an action

name: Objective of this tab - Documentation
info:
# Introduction
Often errors occures because objects or part of objects are not initialized or hold invalid values. This causes errors in following flows. 

# Solution
The path of every property is being intensively checked: **undefined, null, empty string** and not value "**NaN**".

NaN is a strange one. It can be exclued by testing "msg.payload !== msg.payload" or by testing "(typeof msg.payload === 'number' && isNaN(msg.payload))"

The second one is longer but more obsious. 

In case of msg.propLevel1.propLevel2 I do test all elements except msg. Msg is given and can not be null or undefined.

name: payload NaN
func:
msg.payload = parseInt('Hallo');  // provides NaN
return msg;

name: dialog input state overrides msg (required string) - what is tested
info:
1. Command play http stream: string requried

**SONOS payload string, blank**

"b5" should play b5 as payload in node is empty string (ignored) but msg.payload provides valid stream

"payload blank" should cause an error as payload in node is empty string (ignored) and inject does not provide a valid payload.

**SONOS payload string, xxx**
both should throw error as xxxx is not a valid stream - error 714!


**SONOS payload number empty**

"b5" should play b5 as payload in node is empty number(ignored) but msg.payload provides valid stream

"payload blank" should cause an error as payload in node is empty number (ignored) and inject does not provide a valid payload.


**SONOS payload number 5**
Both should provide error as number is not allowed in this case

restore group states from flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
# restore group states from flow variable

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players
- to listen to tv, podcast, line in  and restore after
- 
Works together with create household snapshot flow

## Customizing
 - edit `group.play.snap` and select your configuration node.
 - edit `restore from flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
The original state is restored in all groups.

## Restrictions
What is not restored
 - the original household topology is not restore
 - the queue state such as shuffle or normal
 - the queue entries

name: create snapshop and save in flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
# Creates a snapshot of all group states and the topology in household.

## Use case
 - to play a notification on all players
 - to listen to tv, podcast, line in and restore after

Works together with flow to restore household snapshot.

## Customizing
 - edit `household.get.group`, `group.create.snap` and select your configuration node.
 - edit `set flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
An array of group state snapshopts are stored in the the flow variable. That can be used to restore the household players state.

## Limitations
What is not stored: 
 - the queue state such as shuffle or normal
 - the queue entries

name: ↑just for testing
↑ just for testing
restore topologoy from flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
restore topologoy from flow variable "householdSnapshot"

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players and roll back

## Customizing
 - edit `household.create.group`,  and select your configuration node.
 - edit `set flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
All household players are grouped as defined in the snapshot

## Limitation
 - The coordinator can not be set in this flow. 
 - It may take some seconds until SONOS player have finished their jobs.

## CAUTION
In case your household has a lot of players the creation of a group may take too long and therefore the group creation will fail.

name: ↑just for testing
group all players into single group
info:
# group all players into single group

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players

## Customizing
 - edit `household.get.groups`, `household.create.group` and select your configuration node.

## Result
All household players are in single group.

## Limitation
 - The coordinator is not set in this flow. 
 - It may take some seconds to complete this.

name: Play station KEXP, stored in My Sonos
info:
# Play station KEXP from My Sonos

## Customizing
- In the SONOS app you have to search for KEXP staton and add it to My Sonos stations. 

- mysonos.export.item: payload: KEXP and select your configuration node. 

- group.play.export: select your configuration node.

name: Play the SONOS queue
info:
# Play the SONOS queue

## Customizing
 - edit `group.play.queue `and select your configuration node.

Ensure that the queue is filled with songs. You can to that either with this package or with the SONOS app.

## Customizing
- edit payload and enter the name of your players (not the config node names) and seperate by commad but wihtout any blanks

 - edit `household.create.group`and select your configuration node.
